noun.description: An event causing great suffering, destruction, and distress, such as a serious accident, crime, or natural catastrophe.
examples: his life had been plagued by tragedy

noun.description: A play dealing with tragic events and having an unhappy ending, especially one concerning the downfall of the main character.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French tragedie, via Latin from Greek tragōidia, apparently from tragos goat (the reason remains unexplained) + ōidē song, ode. Compare with tragic.
